H0.text: Oxygen is what most living organisms use to produce ATP from glucose.

H1.text: Enzymes are what most living things use to make ATP from glucose.

H2.text: Carbon is what most living things use to make ATP from glucose.

H3.text: Nitrogen is what most living things use to make ATP from glucose.

A4.text: Aerobic respiration requires oxygen (O2) in order to create ATP.

A5.text: ATP is synthesized by the ATP synthase enzyme when the chemiosmotic gradient is used to drive the phosphorylation of ADP.

A6.text: ATP synthase is an enzyme that catalyzes the formation of the energy storage molecule adenosine triphosphate (ATP) using adenosine diphosphate (ADP) and inorganic phosphate (Pi).

A7.text: The same structure and activity of ATP synthase enzymes are present in all kingdoms of life.
